title: Teen charged with involuntary manslaughter in shooting death of Missouri high school student
content:
SCOTT COUNTY, MO -
The Scott County, Missouri, Sheriff's Department says an 18 year old has been charged with involuntary manslaughter in the death of another teen.
The sheriff's department responded to a call reporting an accidental shooting at 5 p.m. on Thursday at a home on Bugg Street in Vanduser, Missouri. Scott County Sheriff Rick Walter tells us Cole Kirkpatrick died after he was shot in the head with a 20 gauge shotgun.
Walter says Sean Thomas of Vanduser was arrested and charged with armed criminal action and involuntary manslaughter. He is in jail, and bond has been set at $5,000 cash. The sheriff says they don't yet know what led to the shooting.
Walter tells us the teens were friends for years, and the investigation into the shooting is ongoing. Kirkpatrick was a senior at Scott County Central High School.
The district closed all schools Friday at noon after learning about Kirkpatrick's death. The superintendent says he's not yet sure whether schools will remain closed on Monday. He says that will depend on funeral arrangements for Kirkpatrick.
This photo was posted to the Scott County Central High School Facebook page on Friday in honor of their lost student:
